p: The effect of experimental diets on blood parameters of animals are presented in Table 6 and Figure 1. The results revealed that supplementation of ginger powder in the diet had significant effect on the level of triacylglycerol ( p < 0.05). Nevertheless, serum albumin, cholesterol, glucose, MDA, and TAC were not affected by the diet ( p > 0.05). Level of serum TAC only numerically elevated, while MDA level was reduced in birds fed medium level of ginger powder compared with the control group. The effect of experimental treatments on phenolic compounds of the yolk, as shown in Figure 1, was significant ( p < 0.05). Highest concentration of ginger powder (1.5 g/kg diet) was the most effective treatment in stimulating the production of phenolic.
